I just wanted to note that I have not heard very much about the performan=
ce of the Matlab version of NEAT.  Hopefully it works well, but you can als=
o perhaps consider other versions in your experiment.  

For example, ANJI =
NEAT actually comes with an experiment in "active vision" that discriminate=
s shapes:

http://anji.sourceforge.net/

That could be helpful for getting =
started. 

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "mozaher" <mozaher@...> wrote:=

>
> Hi there, 
> We did a bit of work on object recognition using NEAT. Yo=
u can find the details in the following paper:
> Abul Hasanat, M.H.; Harun,=
 S.Z.; Ramachandram, D.; Rajeswari, M.; , "Object Class Recognition Using N=
EAT-Evolved Artificial Neural Network," Computer Graphics, Imaging and Visu=
alisation, 2008. CGIV '08. Fifth International Conference on , vol., no., p=
p.271-275, 26-28 Aug. 2008
> URL: http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/stamp/stamp.js=
p?tp=3D&arnumber=3D4627018&isnumber=3D4626968
> 
> Regards,
> Mozaherul Hoq=
